clinical_study.brief_title: Exploring Biological Linkage Between Circadian Disruption and Cancer Progression
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of Exploring Possible Biological Linkage Between Circadian Disruption and Cancer Progression

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the possible association between the circadian disruption and cancer progression. The biological markers that are assumed to bridge this association are measured and analyzed.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: The data on survival will be verified via Statistics Korea.
The data progression-free survival will be done by reviewing patients' medical record.

secondary_outcome.description: Impact of Event Scale-revised will be used to categorize and quantify Posttraumatic stress-related symptom in cancer patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after 1 month, after 6 month, after 12 month
secondary_outcome.description: Menopause Rating Scale will be used during the assessment.
Temperament and Character Inventory will be used to examine the personality factor in each participant.
Variable Number Tandem Repeat and Single Nucleotide Polymorphism of circadian-rhythm related genes will be examined.
The methylation specific Polymerase Chain Reaction technique will be used to explore methylation patterns in circadian clock gene or in a global gene level.
Salivary cortisol level will be measured multiple times at baseline.
Salivary or Urine melatonin level will be measured.
The various inflammation markers will be measured from blood sample.

arm_group.description: Diagnosed breast cancer patients who are getting chemotherapy for the first time.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: 18-70
- Breast cancer patients who are getting chemotherapy for the first time in life
- Patients are either having stage 4 cancer or starting neoadjuvant chemotherapy.
- Patient have signed on the informed consent, and well understood the objective and procedure of this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients already have received chemotherapy
- Patient had another cancer (except thyroid cancer) within 5 years
- Patient with severe medical condition
- Patient had taken psychiatric medication more than 1 month in life
- Patient worked the night shift for more than 1 month in 6 months
